DOC.brief_summary: Preterm premature rupture membrane ( PPROM ) complication affect 3-4.5 % pregnancy . PPROM main know cause preterm delivery associate worldwide increase rate neonatal maternal morbidity mortality . Despite frequency , little known pathophysiologic mechanism . Mechanical strength provide fetal membrane extracellular collagen matrix . Types I , II , III IV main collagen type membrane . Studies show total collagen content reduce amnion woman preterm PROM . Vitamin C involve metabolism collagen propose play important role maintenance integrity chorioamniotic membrane . Vitamin E may play synergic role vitamin C , increase antioxidant capacity reactive oxygen . Woods et al hypothesized increase dietary consumption supplementation vitamin C E pregnancy might reduce risk portion preterm PROM may mediate oxidative injury fetal membrane . Plessinger et al report pretreatment human amnion-chorion vitamin C E prevent hypochlorous acid-induced membrane damage . Borna et al . report randomized , double-blind control study vitamin C E supplementation , woman preterm rupture membrane singleton gestation 26 34 week randomize vitamin C E supplementation placebo . Supplementation vitamin C E associate longer latency delivery . However , sample size study small . The aim study evaluate effect supplementation vitamin C E preterm premature rupture membrane . We hypothesise supplementation vitamin C E may effective decrease oxidative stress increase latency period .
DOC.brief_title: Does Vitamins C E Supplementation After Preterm Rupture Membranes Prolong Duration Latency ? A Prospective Randomized Controlled Study
DOC.criteria: Patients single nonanomalous fetus PPROM ≥ 24.0 ≤ 34.0 week ' gestation . fetus anomaly , chorioamnionitis , experience PPROM within 14 day either amniocentesis cervical cerclage placement , multiple gestation , obstetrical indication immediate delivery , delivery within 24 h admission intrauterine fetal death time presentation .
